subject: Politics
title: Youth Vote
description: A quick, practical guide to Youth Vote.

hook.text: Young people are passionate about politics online but often don't show up at the polls. Likes aren't votes.

buildup.text: Voters under 30 have the lowest turnout in most democracies. They care but face barriers to participation.

discovery.text: When youth turnout surges, it changes results. Obama's 2008 win relied heavily on young voter enthusiasm.

twist.text: Politicians ignore young voters because they don't vote. They don't vote because politicians ignore them. A cycle.

climax.text: Climate, student debt, and housing are pushing more young people to the polls than in previous generations.

punchline.text: Young voters have the numbers. They just need to use them.

quiz.question: Why do politicians often ignore young voters?
options: Young voters have historically low turnout rates
Young voters always support the same party
